comments.raw_text:
As in the summary: if you have enough browsertabs to fill the tabs toolbar and make it overflow, then the right tab scroll arrow should become enabled after unpinning an app tab, if any tabs are scrolled out of view, but it doesn't always become enabled.

STR:
1 - Pin some tab (I was using the Add-ons Manager) as an app tab
2 - Fill up the tabs toolbar with enough tabs to have tab scroll arrows on both ends of the tabstrip
3 - Select the last (rightmost) tab
4 - Make sure the tabstrip is scrolled all the way to the right, such that the right tab scroll arrow is disabled
5 - Unpin the app tab
6 - Notice that the rightmost tab is now scrolled out of and cropped by the edge of the tabstrip, but the right scroll arrow is still disabled

Expected:
- tab scroll arrow enabled when tabs can be scrolled

Actual:
- tab scroll arrow disabled even though tabs could be scrolled

Or I guess you could say that tab scroll position and arrow state should correspond, either by repositioning scrolled tabs or by enabling the scroll arrow.

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110215 Firefox/4.0b12pre
